events.message: The applicant submitted the mortgage loan application for a new house purchase and included all preliminary information.
The application was reviewed and categorised under the Mortgage Loan cluster based on the keywords related to property acquisition.
A loan officer experienced in mortgage loans was assigned to handle the applicant's case to ensure specialized assistance.
The initial review of the submitted documents and application details began to check completeness and eligibility criteria.
The loan officer requested additional property appraisal reports and verification of income from the applicant.
Applicant submitted the requested documents including the updated property appraisal and recent pay stubs for income verification.
Credit bureau report was obtained and reviewed to assess applicant's creditworthiness for the mortgage loan.
The risk assessment team evaluated all financial data along with credit history to determine the risk level of the loan.
A mortgage loan offer including interest rate and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant for consideration.
The applicant provided feedback on the loan offer, requesting clarification on some payment terms and potential early repayment fees.
The application was escalated to the senior loan committee to review the applicant's request for customized repayment terms.
The senior loan committee approved the mortgage loan with adjusted repayment terms as requested by the applicant.
The approved mortgage loan amount was disbursed to the applicant's account to complete the property purchase transaction.
The loan officer followed up with the applicant to ensure all payment systems are in place and the home purchase process is proceeding smoothly.
The mortgage loan application case was officially closed after confirming the applicantâ€™s satisfaction and completion of the funding process.
